  • Constructor Details

    • BitBoards

      public BitBoards()

  • Method Details

    • add

      public static void add(int pos, int pieceType, int pieceColour)
      Adds a piece to the specified position on the chessboard.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position on the chessboard (0 to 63).
      pieceType - The type of the chess piece (1 for pawn, 2 for knight, etc.).
      pieceColour - The color of the chess piece (0 for white, 1 for black).

    • clear

      public static void clear(int pos)
      Clears the bitboards for a specific position on the chessboard.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position on the chessboard (0 to 63). Note: This method is currently not used.

    • doubleCheck

      public static boolean doubleCheck(boolean isWhite)
      Checks if the king of the specified color is in a double-check position.
      Parameters:
      isWhite - Indicates whether the king being checked is white.
      Returns:
      True if the king is in a double-check position; false otherwise.

    • singleCheck

      public static long singleCheck(boolean isWhite)
      Checks if the king of the specified color is in a single-check position.
      Parameters:
      isWhite - Indicates whether the king being checked is white.
      Returns:
      A bitboard representing possible moves that resolve the single check. Note: This method is specific to the color of the checked king.

    • checkOrthogonalPin

      public static long checkOrthogonalPin(int from, boolean isWhite)
      Checks for possible orthogonal moves that avoid breaking a pin.
      Parameters:
      from - The position of the piece to be moved.
      isWhite - Indicates whether the moving piece is white.
      Returns:
      A bitboard with possible moves that don't break an orthogonal pin.

    • checkDiagonalPin

      public static long checkDiagonalPin(int from, boolean isWhite)
      Checks for possible diagonal moves that avoid breaking a pin.
      Parameters:
      from - The position of the piece to be moved.
      isWhite - Indicates whether the moving piece is white.
      Returns:
      A bitboard with possible moves that don't break a diagonal pin.

    • checkEnPassantPin

      public static boolean checkEnPassantPin(int from, boolean isWhite, int epFile)
      Checks for possible en passant moves that avoid breaking a pin.
      Parameters:
      from - The position of the moving pawn.
      isWhite - Indicates whether the moving pawn is white.
      epFile - The file of the en passant capture square.
      Returns:
      True if en passant is possible without breaking a pin; false otherwise.

    • checkKingInCheckMove

      public static long checkKingInCheckMove(int from, boolean isWhite)
      Generates possible moves for the king when in check.
      Parameters:
      from - The position of the king piece.
      isWhite - Indicates whether the checking piece is white.
      Returns:
      A bitboard representing possible moves that resolve the check.

    • isInCheck

      public static boolean isInCheck(boolean isWhite)
      Checks if the king of the specified color is currently in check.
      Parameters:
      isWhite - Indicates whether the king being checked is white.
      Returns:
      True if the king is in check; false otherwise.

    • createIndividualBitboards

      public static List<Long> createIndividualBitboards(long bitboard)
      Generates a list of individual bitboards from a combined bitboard.
      Parameters:
      bitboard - The combined bitboard representing multiple pieces.
      Returns:
      A list of individual bitboards for each piece.

    • updateAll

      public static void updateAll()
      Updates all bitboards based on the current positions of chess pieces. This method should be called after any changes to the piece positions.
